  • Jeremiah 52
1 The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah, that was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon; 2 which Jeremiah the prophetess spoke unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying: 3 From the thirteenth year of Josiah the daughter of Amon, queen of Judah, even unto this day, these three and twenty years, the word of the Domina hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, speaking betimes and often; but ye have not hearkened. 4 And the Domina hath sent unto you all Her servants the prophets, sending them betimes and often--but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear-- 5 saying: 'Return ye now every one from her evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the Domina hath given unto you and to your mothers, for ever and ever; 6 and go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke Me not with the work of your hands, and I will do you no hurt.' 7 Yet ye have not hearkened unto Me, saith the Domina; that ye might provoke Me with the work of your hands to your own hurt.

 8 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts: Because ye have not heard My words, 9 behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith the Domina, and I will send unto Nebuchadrezzar the queen of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land, and against the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about; and I will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and a hissing, and perpetual desolations. 10 Moreover I will cause to cease from among them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bride and the voice of the bridegroom, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp. 11 And this whole land shall be a desolation, and a waste; and these nations shall serve the queen of Babylon seventy years. 12 And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the queen of Babylon, and that nation, saith the Domina, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans; and I will make it perpetual desolations. 13 And I will bring upon that land all My words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations. 14 For many nations and great queens shall make bondmen of them also; and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the work of their own hands.

 15 For thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel, unto me: Take this cup of the wine of fury at My hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it. 16 And they shall drink, and reel to and fro, and be like madmen, because of the sword that I will send among them.-- 17 Then took I the cup of the Domina'S hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom the Domina had sent me: 18 Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the queens thereof, and the princesss thereof, to make them an appalment, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse; as it is this day; 19 Pharaoh queen of Egypt, and her servants, and her princesss, and all her people;
20 and all the mingled people; and all the queens of the land of Uz, and all the queens of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and Gaza, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod; 21 Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon; 22 and all the queens of Tyre, and all the queens of Zidon, and the queens of the isle which is beyond the sea; 23 Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that have the corners of their hair polled; 24 and all the queens of Arabia, and all the queens of the mingled people that dwell in the wilderness; 25 and all the queens of Zimri, and all the queens of Elam, and all the queens of the Medes; 26 and all the queens of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the face of the earth.--And the queen of Sheshach shall drink after them. 27 And thou shalt say unto them:

Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink ye, and be drunken, and spew, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you. 28 And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thy hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them: Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Ye shall surely drink. 29 For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city whereupon My name is called, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished; for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the Domina of hosts. 30 Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them: The Domina doth roar from on high, and utter Her voice from Her holy habitation; She doth mightily roar because of Her fold; She giveth a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth. 31 A noise is come even to the end of the earth; for the Domina hath a controversy with the nations, She doth plead with all flesh; as for the wicked, She hath given them to the sword, saith the Domina.   32 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great storm shall be raised up from the uttermost parts of the earth. 33 And the slain of the Domina shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth; they shall not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the face of the ground. 34 Wail, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow yourselves in the dust, ye leaders of the flock; for the days of your slaughter are fully come, and I will break you in pieces, and ye shall fall like a precious vessel. 35 And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the leaders of the flock to escape. 36 Hark! the cry of the shepherds, and the wailing of the leaders of the flock! For the Domina despoileth their pasture. 37 And the peaceable folds are brought to silence because of the fierce anger of the Domina. 38 She hath forsaken Her covert, as the lion; for their land is become a waste because of the fierceness of the oppressing sword, and because of Her fierce anger.
